text: Saul Perlmutter (born September 22, 1959) is an American astrophysicist. He worked at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory and a professor of physics at the University of California, Berkeley. He is a member of the American Academy of Arts & Sciences. Perlmutter won the 2011 Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Illinois Category:People from Champaign, Illinois
title: Saul Perlmutter
